intro: Jacquemontia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas Jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Mexico. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes morning glory plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and can grow as a vine or a shrub. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
